III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Administration team talked with this consultant about the potential use of Narcan
for an emergency situation. This consultant provided the feedback that as of right
now there is nothing specific within the rules as it pertains to Narcan and this is a
topic that will be brought back to the upper administration at DCWL.
2

Administration team reported they will wait to hear from the consultant prior to any
implementation of the use of Narcan.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Administration team talked with this consultant about if they were to get funding
for updating their facility, what steps would need to be taken. This consultant
provided consultation that when the team starts to talk about specifically what they
want to update to the building, the administration should include this consultant
into the conversation. This consultant spoke with the administration team that
depending on the work that will be done, there may need to be a plan review
completed with the fire bureau before any construction could be done and the
length of time that could take.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
Not Applicable
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. Staff reported they feel well
supported by their coworkers, supervisors, and upper administration. Staff reported
3

they strive to use verbal de-escalation skills with the youth when they are in
heightened behavior rather than going hands on or placing the youth into seclusion.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported they feel
safe at the facility and they have positive relationships with the staff. They reported
they feel their voice is heard by administration when they have a complaint about a
situation. The detention center youth reported they enjoy spending more time in the
common area where they can interact with others, read a book, or play games. The
treatment center youth reported they like that they get to wear their own clothing,
have more freedom to go outside on their own in the courtyard area, and have
visitation off grounds with family. The youth did not report any safety concerns to
this consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on October 1, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
